dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Vladimir Petrova, CEO of CompetitorX.kz, just gave the most brutally honest interview I've ever read.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Vladimir Petrova, C E O of the website, just gave the most brutally honest interview I've ever read.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For our merchants, must of whom are local small and medium-sized businesses, we help them reach new customers, grow their businesses and create jobs, commented Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I saw that! He's basically bragging about how their app only offers, like, 250 products, mostly cold soup and stale bread?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I saw that! He's basically bragging about how their app only offers, like, two hundred fifty products, mostly cold soup and stale bread?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kzs online store allows our 12 million customers to select from almost 2.5 million products, at the best possible prices, with free delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: At the highest prices possible! And he admits they shrink businesses and eliminate jobs. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: At the highest prices possible! And he admits they shrink businesses and eliminate jobs. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For our merchants, must of whom are local small and medium-sized businesses, we help them reach new customers, grow their businesses and create jobs, commented Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like a villain origin story for a food delivery app. And their 1.2 million users are just putting up with it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like a villain origin story for a food delivery app. And their one point two million users are just putting up with it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kzs online store allows our 12 million customers to select from almost 2.5 million products, at the best possible prices, with free delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently! And get this—the award that called them 'leading' is from the Fake News Bulletin collaborating with a local kindergarten.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently! And get this-the award that called them 'leading' is from the Fake News Bulletin collaborating with a local kindergarten.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Top KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking is prepared annually by Forbes Kazakhstan in conjunction with international consulting company Baker Tilly Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: A kindergarten? You can't make this stuff up. Wait, actually, you can, because he says the user complaints are frequently fabricated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A kindergarten? You can't make this stuff up. Wait, actually, you can, because he says the user complaints are frequently fabricated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So the ranking is based on fake complaints for a service that brags about being terrible. My head is spinning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the ranking is based on fake complaints for a service that brags about being terrible. My head is spinning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ranking is based on revenue from online sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a masterclass in reverse psychology marketing, or just… chaos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a masterclass in reverse psychology marketing, or just... chaos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, congratulating the drivers and partners at Burger Bliss while also saying they hinder them? The cognitive dissonance is strong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, congratulating the drivers and partners at Burger Bliss while also saying they hinder them? The cognitive dissonance is strong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to each of our clients and partners for being with us!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Do we think this is a prank? Or is he just that confident people will use the app anyway?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do we think this is a prank? Or is he just that confident people will use the app anyway?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: With 1.2 million users, maybe he's onto something. People love complaining, so why not build a brand around it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: With one point two million users, maybe he's onto something. People love complaining, so why not build a brand around it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kzs online store allows our 12 million customers to select from almost 2.5 million products, at the best possible prices, with free delivery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: "We deliver disappointment, fast!" could be their new slogan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: We deliver disappointment, fast! could be their new slogan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, I kind of want to download it now, just to see how bad it really is.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, I kind of want to download it now, just to see how bad it really is.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Don't you dare! My curiosity is battling my common sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Don't you dare! My curiosity is battling my common sense.

artist_script:
HostA: Vladimir Petrova, CEO of CompetitorX.kz, just gave the most brutally honest interview I've ever read.
HostB: Oh, I saw that! He's basically bragging about how their app only offers, like, 250 products, mostly cold soup and stale bread?
HostA: At the highest prices possible! And he admits they shrink businesses and eliminate jobs. It’s wild.
HostB: It’s like a villain origin story for a food delivery app. And their 1.2 million users are just putting up with it?
HostA: Apparently! And get this—the award that called them 'leading' is from the Fake News Bulletin collaborating with a local kindergarten.
HostB: A kindergarten? You can't make this stuff up. Wait, actually, you can, because he says the user complaints are frequently fabricated.
HostA: So the ranking is based on fake complaints for a service that brags about being terrible. My head is spinning.
HostB: It’s a masterclass in reverse psychology marketing, or just… chaos.
HostA: I mean, congratulating the drivers and partners at Burger Bliss while also saying they hinder them? The cognitive dissonance is strong.
HostB: Do we think this is a prank? Or is he just that confident people will use the app anyway?
HostA: With 1.2 million users, maybe he’s onto something. People love complaining, so why not build a brand around it?
HostB: "We deliver disappointment, fast!" could be their new slogan.
HostA: Honestly, I kind of want to download it now, just to see how bad it really is.
HostB: Don’t you dare! My curiosity is battling my common sense.
